title: Bug 120922: "Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description:
Bug 120922: "Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement. Other pages cannot be used until the source is saved (including the quotes). The user needs to figure out how to save or discard their changes. A dialog box titled "Error" (including the quotes) is displayed. The options are: 

- Yes: saves the changes
- No: discards the changes
- Cancel: does nothing and remains on the Source page.

A better and more typical approach would be to display a dialog with a more appropriate title without the quotes.
OB: When editing the XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor and then trying to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed indicating that the changes need to be saved. However, the error message is not very clear.
EB: A better and more typical approach would be: The XML Report Design has been modified. The dialog box should have a better title (without quotes).
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 

1. Open the XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor.
2. Make some changes to the XML.
3. Try to switch back to the Layout view.
4. Observe the error message: "Source page is dirty."
